item.title: 【UPSCALED】London Grammar - Hey Now [4K AI Upscale | HEVC 10-bit | PCM 24-bit 44.1 kHz]
item.description:
Genre: Electronic, Rock, Pop
Style: Indie Pop, Synth-pop
Year: 2013
Video Source: Vimeo, WebMaster
Audio Source: Qobuz, Hi-Res

"Hey Now" is a song by British trip hop trio London Grammar from their debut studio album If You Wait (2013). It was released in the United Kingdom on 16 March 2014 as a digital download. It has peaked at number 37 on the UK Singles Chart, and has also charted in France. It was written by Hannah Reid, Dot Major, Daniel Rothman and produced by Tim Bran, Roy Kerr and London Grammar.

The music video of "Hey Now", directed by Chris Ullens, was released on YouTube on 19 February 2014. As of February 2023, it has received more than 35 million views. What the clip may lack in any observable plot, it more than makes up for with beguiling visuals that enhance the track’s haunting, ethereal feel. The video plays with stop-motion animation to create this fantastical forest landscape, one where tiny orbs of light combine to form these hairy shapes that generate large light shows. It’s all very surreal and matches the tone of the song perfectly.

Release Info
The video track is upscaled from 1080p to 4K with Topaz Video AI and encoded to HEVC 10-bit.
The PCM track is lossless (Qobuz Hi-Res 24-bit 44.1 kHz) and synced with Adobe Audition.
The timed lyrics are synced and edited. Enable the subtitles to see the lyrics.
